snippet: Claims have been below 300,000, a threshold associated with healthy labor market conditions, for 54 weeks, the longest stretch since 1973.
abstract: Labor Dept reports initial claims for state unemployment benefits increased 7,000 to seasonally adjusted 265,000 for week ending March 12, and job openings increased by 26,000 to six-month high of 5.5 million in January; Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia says mid-Atlantic region manufacturing rose, and Commerce Dept reports current-account deficit fell.
lead_paragraph: Claims have been below 300,000, a threshold associated with healthy labor market conditions, for 54 weeks, the longest stretch since 1973.

headline.main: Unemployment Claims Rise; Job Openings Hit Six-Month High
headline.print_headline: Jobless Claims Rise, but Job Openings Hit 6-Month High
